item.title: Council property Ivy dragging down fencing, 5th November
item.description:
The vastly overgrown ivy from the council property next door (No 22) is causing long term damage to our and neighbours' property. Weight and damp of ivy pulling down fencing, tree, and sheds.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brookfield Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street damaged in close proximity to a manhole, 5th November
item.description:
Good day, Seven Sisters' High road presents a damaged street in close proximity to a manhole. This damage might cause incident in the future, should the manhole collapse due to continous traffic on top of it. When an heavy lorry or bus passes on top, the building where I live shakes quite a lot. The damage is next to College of North East London bus stop. If you could do something to fix it, I'd be really grateful.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 274, High Road, West Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Various Pot Holes, areas of road surface sunk & erupted joins in road surface, 5th November
item.description:
I have been advised by my solicitor to report this on here even though David Leaf is already aware of the issues we are facing: Since the introduction of the new electric bus and any other heavy truck passes our houses, things in my and various neighbours houses vibrate. Even my wardrobe doors vibrate when a heavy vehicle passes. I have already had dealings with David Leaf who confirmed the electric buses are somewhat heavier than the diesel ones but TFL is avoiding responsibility as it is, apparently, within their weight limits. I and several of my neighbours feel this is extremely unacceptable as it has already caused a crack to appear in the wall of my house and other neighbours are experiencing similar. A few weeks ago, the road work men started about 10 houses down from my house and stripped the surface down to Sherwood Park Avenue and then resurfaced it which sorted the vibrations for that end of the road (as I had previously knocked on doors, the majority of whom were experiencing vibrations) and I thought they would do our end (Blackfen Road down to where they had already resurfaced but they just cleared off. If this end of the road is not sorted out to stop the vibrations in our houses, I (and probably several of my neighbours) intend suing the L.B Bexley for the damage to our houses as I have spent a hell of a lot of money on my house to get it looking the way I want it to look only for other people to damage it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Ramillies Road, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet
